https://prez.dev/description.@value: The art, science, and technology of obtaining reliable information from noncontact imaging and other sensor systems about the Earth and its environment, and other physical objects and of processes through recording, measuring, analyzing and representation. Source:International Archives of the Photogrammetry, Remote Sensing and Spatial Information Sciences, Volume XXXIX-B6, 2012 XXII ISPRS Congress, 25 August â€“ 01 September 2012, Melbourne, Australia.
The subject is an instance of a class.
The defininition of the subject resource.
An idea or notion; a unit of thought
An alternative lexical label for a resource
Relates a concept to a concept that is more general in meaning
A statement or formal explanation of the meaning of a concept

skos:exactMatch is used to link two concepts, indicating a high degree of confidence that the concepts can be used interchangeably across a wide range of information retrieval applications. skos:exactMatch is a transitive property, and is a sub-property of skos:closeMatch
A note about the past state/use/meaning of a concept
Relates a resource (for example a concept) to a concept scheme in which it is included
skos:narrowMatch is used to state a hierarchical mapping link between two conceptual resources in different concept schemes
Relates a concept to a concept that is more specific in meaning
A notation, also known as classification code, is a string of characters such as 'T58.5' or '303.4833' used to uniquely identify a concept within the scope of a given concept scheme
The preferred lexical label for a resource, in a given language

https://prez.dev/label.@value: 1297.0 ANZSRC - Australian and New Zealand Standard Research Classification, 2020: Fields of Research (FoR)

https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The science and technology of collecting/measuring, processing, analysing and interpreting information from noncontact imaging and other sensor systems that record the interaction between electromagnetic energy and matter, i.e. the acquisition of information about an object or phenomenon by using a recording device that is not in physical contact with the subject being studied. Aerial photographs and imagery acquired from a satellite or drone are examples of remotely sensed information.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: From the Fields of Research vocabulary from the Australian and New Zealand Standard Research Classification (ANZSRC, 2020). Definition adapted from Glossary of geology (5th edition revised; Neuendorf et al., 2011) and Wikipedia.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: The science and technology of collecting/measuring, processing, analysing and interpreting information from noncontact imaging and other sensor systems that record the interaction between electromagnetic energy and matter, i.e. the acquisition of information about an object or phenomenon by using a recording device that is not in physical contact with the subject being studied. Aerial photographs and imagery acquired from a satellite or drone are examples of remotely sensed information.

The use of multiple bands across the electromagnetic spectrum to create a dataset that contains many images of the same object, where each one of them is measured at a different wavelength. It includes multispectral imaging that typically captures three to fifteen spectral bands, and hyperspectral imaging that combines spectroscopy and digital photography to capture hundreds of wavelength bands.
A profile for SKOS Concept Schemes
A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc
